section.p: DITA Open Toolkit Release requires the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) version or later.
DITA-OT includes preview support for the upcoming Lightweight DITA initiative, normalized DITA output, a map-first preprocessing option as an alternative to the default preprocess operation, and….

section.title: Normalized DITA output
section.p: The new dita transformation generates normalized topics and maps from DITA input. The normalized output includes the results of the DITA Open Toolkit pre-processing operations, which resolve map references, keys, content references, code references and push metadata back and forth between maps and topics.
In comparison to the source DITA files, the normalized DITA files are modified in the following ways:

ul.li: References from one DITA map to another are resolved
Map-based links, such as those generated by map hierarchy and relationship tables, are added to the topics.
Link text is resolved.
Map attributes that cascade are made explicit on child elements.
Map metadata such as index entries and copyrights are pushed into topics.
Topic metadata such as navigation titles, link text and short descriptions are pulled from topics into the map.
XML comments are removed.

section.p: Normalized output may be useful in situations where post-processing of DITA content is required, but the downstream systems are limited in their ability to resolve DITA references.
section.note: The dita transformation can also be used to convert Markdown topics or other alternative input formats supported by the org.lwdita plug-in to standard DITA XML.

section.p: In addition to the highlights mentioned above, DITA Open Toolkit Release includes the following changes.

section.title: Features
section.p: DITA Open Toolkit Release includes the following new features:

ul.li: Parameter for customizing the name of output file #1200
Move from custom logging to SLF4J and Logback #1471
Generate HTML Help in temporary directory #1551
Add support for subject schemes in map-first preprocess #2626
Extension point for Ant import task #2766
Add Markdown plugin to distribution package #2774

ul.li: Separate all transtype plugins into own Git repos #2121
Use XMLUnit 2 #2232, #2723
Relationship table accessibility #2447
Update Gradle to 3.5 #2713
When producing a PDF file with a XML extension, the extension shows up in the output filename #2718
Update to Saxon-HE 9.8 #2721, #2727
Upgrade to FOP 2.2 #2736
Preserve submap elements when merging #2739
Add flagging information during filtering #2748
Allow for plugin param type 'url' #2755
Use map-first preprocessing in transtypes #2763
Move or rename Java classes #2765
Make it easier to convert @outputclass attribute value to another attribute in PDF output #2770

Separate configuration to own directory #2781, #2783

Support language-independent variable files #2789
Use doubled dashes in messages #2808
Refactor HTML5 simpletable accessibility for modern approach #2811

section.p: DITA Open Toolkit Release provides fixes for the following bugs:

ul.li: Images referenced in conref source copied to output #1364
NullPointerException when processing invalid email link bug P1 preprocess #2654

Fix failing relative path test on Windows #2797
Replace wrapping p with wrapping div for stepsection elements in HTML5 #2807
